Metadata.Title: Make the Session Expire When the User Logs Out
Metadata.DirectLink: Make the Session Expire When the User Logs Out

Content.Data:
Applies To

  • ASP.NET

What to Do

Make the session expire when the user logs out.

Why

Making the session expire when the user logs out makes it harder for an attacker to hijack the session.

When

Make sessions expire upon user logout in all applications that implement authentication.

How

To make sessions expire when users log out:

  1. Identify logout functionality. Find code that is responsible for the logout functionality.

  2. Add code to make sessions expire. Add the following code to the logout function to make the session expire:

    Response.Cookies.Add(new HttpCookie("ASP.NET_SessionId", ""));
    Session.Abandon();
